definition: lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
leopard/panther
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
spot/colored patch/stripe/spotted/striped/variegated

sentences.english: Of course, the monthly statistics only tell part of the story.
sentences.chinese: 当然，一个月的数据仅够窥豹一斑。

definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
to find out about/to discover
lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
some cases picked out as example/to highlight
tip of the iceberg
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
see 獨具隻眼|独具只眼[du2 ju4 zhi1 yan3]
the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
in my humble opinion (idiom)
